headline: EXCLUSIVE: Maricopa County Supervisor Bill Gates Continues to Play Victim and Refuses to Turn Election Routers Over to Inspectors… Why Is That? (VIDEO)
author: Jordan Conradson
sentences: He chose to resign after The Gateway Pundit reported on secret audio recordings where Chucri was saying, multi-faceted election fraud and ballot harvesting changed the election, and that Maricopa County’s audit was “bullsh*t.” He also said that he does not feel comfortable with Dominion Voting Machines and that Maricopa County Recorder Stephen Richer agrees!

And I think humbly you know that that may be part of why we’ve been able to keep this team together because they’ve seen us, they’ve seen Stephen Richer, our new recorder and just for those who don’t know Stephen Richer, as David mentioned, he beat Adrian Fontes, the Democrat recorder in 2020.

This panel aimed to discredit evidence of election fraud and claim the 2020 election was “the most secure, transparent, and verified election in history.”
The panelists repeated the debunked lies that Russia influenced the 2016 election and that 2020 was the most secure election in history.

Maricopa County Chairman Bill Gates, Michigan Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson, and Pasco County Supervisor Brian Corely recently chaired a McCain Institute panel titled, “Defending American Democracy: When Local Elections Are Threatened, What Are The National Implications?”.

The Attorney General threatened to take over $700 million in state-shared revenues away from Maricopa County, which would have put us out of business because we refused to turn over routers at the request of President Trump.

During the House Oversight Committee hearing last October, Rep. Andy Biggs asked Maricopa County officials why they deleted data from the Dominion election equipment after it was subpoenaed by the Arizona State Senate.

The Attorney General did, in fact, threaten to withhold 10% of state shared revenues from Maricopa County after months of noncompliance with legal and enforceable Arizona Senate subpoenas and multiple warnings.

Stephen Richer’s fingerprints are all over the 2020 election because he ran a campaign against the election fraud perpetrated by former County Recorder Adrian Fontes and Secretary of State Katie Hobbs.
